title: VR-Based Local History and Culture Exploration Project

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of regional history and proficiency in using digital devices
context.additional_context: Students virtually visit local cultural heritage sites using VR devices and explore the value and modern significance of regional history through projects linked to social studies. In classes of 30+, small-group (5-6 members) collaboration provides differentiated learning experiences.

learning_goals: Students can accurately explain the spatial and temporal contexts of local historical-cultural heritage through VR experiences with 80%+ accuracy.
Based on VR-based inquiry activities, learners can analyze and summarize three or more social issues related to local history.
Through project outcomes, present two or more cases of interaction between local history and global cultures.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
